newsitem.title: FRANCE: Third British youth dies in bus crash in France.
newsitem.headline: Third British youth dies in bus crash in France.

text.p: A third British teenager has died overnight from injuries suffered on Monday when a bus carrying children on a school trip in eastern France veered off a road, British and French officials said on Tuesday.
The child, identified by the British Consulate as Keith Ridding, 14, died early on Tuesday in hospital in the Alpine city of Grenoble, the officials said.
His mother was at his side at the time of his death, a British Consulate official said.
The bus had driven off the road on Monday near the town of Moutiers, falling 20 metres (60 feet) into a ravine before eventually coming to rest on its side against a tree.
The victims were all from the northern British town of Bolton. Schoolgirl Nicola Moore, 16, had died almost immediately after the accident and Robert Boardman, 14, died in hospital later.
The bus was carrying 23 people from a holiday camp to a rock-climbing site. Those on board included the driver, 16 youths and six adults who were accompanying the young people.
The cause of the accident was unknown. Police said they have been unable to question the driver, also a Briton, who remained in a state of shock.
